definition[0]: to turn or spin around very quickly, or to make someone or something do this
example[0]: We watched the seagulls whirling and shrieking over the harbour.
example[1]: She whirled around and her look shook him.
example[2]: He whirled her round in his arms.
definition[1]: if your head is whirling, or if thoughts are whirling in your head, your mind is full of thoughts and ideas, and you feel very confused or excited
example[3]: His head was whirling with excitement.
example[4]: The implications began to whirl around in her head.
definition[2]: a lot of activity of a particular kind
example[5]: the social whirl of New York publishing
example[6]: The next two days passed in a whirl of activity.
definition[3]: a spinning movement or the shape of something that is spinning
example[7]: A car rumbled over the bumpy dirt road, leaving behind a whirl of white dust.
